definition: to make one's home in a place/to settle
surname An
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
a household/door/family

sentences.chinese: 你能在这里安家落户吗？

sentences.english: Now it is finding a home in China.
sentences.chinese: 于国外，现在沙画在中国安家落户。
他们已经在海南岛安家落户。

sentences.english: The state shall encourage veteran cadres to settle in the countryside or in small or medium-sized cities or towns.
sentences.chinese: 国家鼓励离休干部到农村或中小城镇安家落户。

sentences.english: He has determined to settle down in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 他决定在农村安家落户。

sentences.english: Many professors have made their homes in Rizhao.
sentences.chinese: 日照吸引了不少教授在这里安家落户。

sentences.english: He said that as early as the beginning of the 1800s, the Chinese had started settling here.
sentences.chinese: 他说，早在19世纪初，就有中国人来这里安家落户。

sentences.english: The art of sand painting first started abroad, Now it is finding a home in China.
sentences.chinese: 沙画起源于国外，现在沙画在中国安家落户。

sentences.english: They have made it easier for rural folk to obtain permission to settle in a middle-sized city than in a large one.
sentences.chinese: 他们使农民在中型城市安家落户比在大城市容易。

sentences.english: They settled down in the countryside to steel their wills.
sentences.chinese: 他们到农村安家落户以锻炼自己的意志。

sentences.english: Men do not find it to be all smooth sailing when they settle down in a new colony.
sentences.chinese: 人们发觉到新殖民地安家落户并非一帆风顺。

definition: to settle down/to set up a home
stable household, established profession (idiom); settled and comfortably off
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to move in (to new lodging)
Anju district of Suining city 遂寧市|遂宁市[Sui4 ning2 shi4], Sichuan
to settle down/to live peacefully
to stay at/to live in (temporarily)
to migrate/to move
to reside/to dwell/to live in a place/resident in
comfortable niche
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
to move (from one residence to another)
to multiply/to reproduce/to increase gradually in number or quantity
to move away/to change residence
to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
to take all one's family along (idiom); encumbered by a family/tied down by family obligations
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
